channel.title: How 'easy' is login, rendering (including npc and player), talking, and such
channel.description: I was browsing through rune-server and I saw a 562 framework. It only had login and some basic rendering. Then, I saw another person can that he could make full rendering, talking, and such in 5 minutes. I was thinking that he was probably lying, but then, the next day he released it. Completely shocked me. Especially the comments saying, "Login takes 2 minutes.", "Talking is easy...", "Rendering takes like 5 minutes..." So guys, I ask you, is it really that 'easy' as they say it is?

item.title: How 'easy' is login, rendering (including npc and player), talking, and such
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Clawz fury:

then how did you guys add netty to that server (I can’t recall the name) o.o

Project Zeta/DalaCity? I think I recall RandQm telling me he was learning Netty. Imma go through chat logs.

Read full topic

item.source: How 'easy' is login, rendering (including npc and player), talking, and such

item.title: How 'easy' is login, rendering (including npc and player), talking, and such
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:5, topic:508561”]lol, login is easy after a bit of practice but anything after that is pretty hard

Also, talking would be a packet, unless you meant forced chat, which would be an update mask (player updating). I thought you already knew how to make a server from scratch, I remember I was begging you and randqm to teach me about netty over skype hahahaha.[/quote]
Randqm I believe only knows IO. I barely know anything.

eyeownyew:

Sooo I can make a server in ~3 minutes, but player updating takes me several hours minimum if it’s going to be done well

Oh, cool.

sinisoul:

On my current framework it has taken me months of planning to get as far as I have, and I have not gotten into rendering. Depends if you are being serious about the project.

Okay, thanks. I’ll keep that in mind once I get more knowledge.

HcoJustin:

If you rip together bits and pieces of other servers it could easily be done in a matter of minutes… If you want to take the time to design a well written core we can’t exactly put a time frame on that

Yeah, I can see.

Read full topic
item.source: How 'easy' is login, rendering (including npc and player), talking, and such

@Clawz_fury wrote:

lol, login is easy after a bit of practice but anything after that is pretty hard

Also, talking would be a packet, unless you meant forced chat, which would be an update mask (player updating). I thought you already knew how to make a server from scratch, I remember I was begging you and randqm to teach me about netty over skype hahahaha.

item.source: How 'easy' is login, rendering (including npc and player), talking, and such

item.title: How 'easy' is login, rendering (including npc and player), talking, and such
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Lin:

If the protocol is documented and you don’t care about speed, yes, it’s very easy. However when you want a fast system that can handle hundreds and up to 2000 players, it’s a lot harder. You can rest assured knowing his performance was probably shit.

Ah, thanks.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

Login is super easy and takes only basic networking knowledge, however, the entity updating and what not take much longer considering there are so many different ways of doing it.

Read full topic
